NewWords.WordPhrase: n., a. opposite 反面（的）；相反（的）
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Cruelty is the contrary of kindness.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. serving to keep in mind 纪念（性）的  n. sth. done or made to remind people of an event, person, etc. 纪念物；纪念碑；纪念仪式
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. A memorial service is being held for her in St Paul's Church.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. (dwelt or dwelled) reside 居住
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. American Indians used to dwell in the forests.

NewWords.WordPhrase: a. full of, covered in, mystery 神秘的
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. They're being very mysterious about their holiday plans.

NewWords.WordPhrase: continue to live or exist 继续生活；继续存在
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. She lived on for many years after her husband died.
e.g. They moved to Europe shortly after that.
e.g. His mistakes led to his failure.

NewWords.WordPhrase: v. make or become unclear（使）变模糊
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His eyes were blurred with tears.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. sth. that has real existence; a thing's existence 实际存在物；实体
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Persons and corporations are equivalent entities under the law.

NewWords.WordPhrase: ad. supposedly 可能，大概，据推测
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Presumably the bad weather has delayed the flight.
e.g. Now we've talked about work on tulips, what of other commercially important flowers, like roses?

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. cause to appear small by contrast or distance 使显得渺小，使相形见绌
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. His children were dwarfed by insufficient food.

NewWords.WordPhrase: away from one's country or home, esp. as a punishment 于流放中
v. have as a cause or beginning; be the creator of 起源于，来自
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The use of steam originated many other reforms.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. class or group of things in a complete system of grouping 种类；范畴
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There are different categories of books in the library.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. state of being miserable; great suffering 悲惨的境遇；苦难，不幸
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. lead a life of misery

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. system of moral principles, rules of conduct 道德标准，行为准则
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. Such an action is a violation of medical ethics.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. an element of a specified kind in sb.'s character 个性特征
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. There is a streak of cruelty in his character.
